title: Safe Contact with Friendly Patrols
brief: Make safe contact with friendly forces using proper identification procedures to avoid being shot.
steps: Step 1: Remain concealed and allow patrol to move toward your position.
Step 2: When patrol is 25-50 meters away, signal with white cloth or article of clothing.
Step 3: Call out a greeting that is clearly and unmistakably of American origin.
Step 4: Stand up from behind cover with hands overhead and state 'I am an American'.
Step 5: Follow any instructions given by the patrol members.
Step 6: Avoid answering tactical questions initially.
Step 7: Only reveal other team members after verifying friendly identity.
warnings: Distances less than 25 meters may cause patrol members to fire instantly.
Distances greater than 50 meters may cause recon patrols to avoid contact.
You are considered hostile until positive identification is made.
Contact must be made during daylight when there is enough light for identification.
